macro.abstract: The macro is a user-defined that specifies the lower and upper bounds of a .

macro.para: This macro is defined by the user to specify the boundaries of a . It is automatically undefined by the library.

Both lower and upper parameters are fully evaluated. This implies that they may contain arithmetic, logical, and bitwise expressions.
#define (S, S + 10)
Note that if upper is less than lower, the mechanism will iterate in reverse.
